results.title: Yellow Submarine
results.creator_credit: George Dunning, Al Brodax, TV Cartoons, Apple Films, Subafilms and King Features Entertainment
results.brief_description: This animated feature has the Beatles on an odyssey to Pepperland, ‘18000 leagues beneath the sea’, to take on the music-hating Blue Meanies. Pepperland was a paradise until the “Meanies” moved in and everyone had given up hope. Until the Beatles arrived in their yellow submarine to save the day. It is a fascinating but uneven anthology of contemporary art and graphic design up to the late sixties - surrealism, art nouveau, op and pop art - brought together by designer Edelman’s flattened comic strip, Lennon style whimsy out of Lear and Carroll and play upon the Beatles’ myth. Stand-out sequences include ‘Sergeant Pepperland’, the Borowczyk-style Liverpool sequence, ‘Eleanor Rigby’ with Charles Jenkins’ special effects, ‘Nowhere Man’ and Dunning’s rotoscoped ‘Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds’. Voices: John Clive, Geoffrey Hughes, Peter Batten, Paul Angelis, Dick Emery, Lance Percival.

results.title: Yellow morning
results.creator_credit: Caitlin Foley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Over breakfast, Caitlin Foley and her family spotted a tornado coming from over the water. Caitlin’s mum said they never make it onto the land. Despite hitting the community so suddenly and quickly, the tornado left physical and emotional devastation in its wake.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: Yellow earth
results.brief_description: Despite several decades of communist rule in China, the peasantry in many places and in many ways remained nearly as backward and poor as before “liberation.” This drama is about a young girl from a poor family, trapped and trying to escape from that way of life and an arranged marriage. One of the most important films of the Chinese new wave. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Yellow dog dingo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Graziers have claimed for years that the dingo is responsible for heavy stock losses, specially among sheep. The Australian Meat Research Committee responded by earmarking funds for a scientific study of the dog. A team from the CSIRO’s Division of Wildlife Research in Canberra was mobilised in 1966 to carry out the study. Across Central Australia and the East Coast, the dogs were observed, tracked and examined in their own domain for thousands of hours. The difficulty it seems is that there is no one answer for dingo management in the scientific sense for any place in Australia and any one answer therefore for all of Australia. Management will have to be much more flexible, changing from place to place and from time to time.

results.title: Yehudi Menuhin: the violin of the century
results.creator_credit: Bruno Monsaingeon, Pierre-Olivier Bardet, INA France, Imalyre-Group France Telecom, La Sept-Arte and Ideale Audience
results.brief_description: A world-class violinist, a committed teacher of young musicians, an active supporter of human rights, a compassionate man. Now in his eighties, Yehudi Menuhin relaxes at home and reflects on his remarkable life. Using a wealth of archival footage, this documentary traces Lord Meuhin’s long and varied career, his childhood, his musical influences, and his humanity for those less fortunate than himself.
